data.text: @lapublichealth Seeing those hospitalizations come down is really great, but how many actually have covid symptoms? lac+usc leadership says “very very very” rarely now  do those positive covid patients they are admitting actually have covid disease. This is good news all should know

@adamfelber @JeordeC @lapublichealth Yeah.  That’s like saying CA continued decline in the last 2 weeks is because LA and schools is still have a mask mandate. It’s a dumb argument. The easiest way to say it is why did CA perform the same or worse than AZ TX and AZ this winter? It’s 2022 not 2020.

@Skwidwurd2 @GBx2TrueLove @lapublichealth This is the last one to you,& I mean it sincerely.However u wanna take it is up to u. Do something meaningful with your life,read books,try to travel out of the country,learn different cultures. Try to find a learning opportunity in every experience. Life is precious, cherish it.

@Skwidwurd2 @GBx2TrueLove @lapublichealth Seriously kid,stop tweeting & read Man's Search for Meaning by Viktor Frankl. It'll be good for your future& building ur character. If you wanna win then you win.But you should know that life has a lot more to offer.There's a purpose.Hug ur loved ones & ur friends.Respect life.
@DaGecko2 @lapublichealth Yeah the rate of decrease is not slowing down, so we might get there.

@Skwidwurd2 @GBx2TrueLove @lapublichealth "You were probably beaten up in middle school"🤣 you so are a teenager. It's okay kid,it's important to understand early that you don't have to live your life choosing to be ignorant. It's obvious you r influenced by toxic masculinity as well.Try to learn to find meaning in life.
@RobbieHutton1 @lapublichealth Let's see.  I truly hope so.

@Clippersfann203 @Linda_Squires @lapublichealth There is no need to be so nasty.   The anti mask people run very unkind.  Nothing she said warrants any type of unkind remark.  So maybe you chill instead.
